intro: Octomeria cucullata, commonly known as the hooded octomeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture.
